# Chemist
## Objectives As a [color=#a4885c]Chemist[/color], your role is to [color=#a4885c]produce[/color] the [color=#a4885c]chemicals[/color] needed around the station. 

 These can include but are not limited to : - [color=#a4885c]Medicine[/color] for the rest of the [color=#a4885c]Medical staff[/color], - Anything the [color=#a4885c]Botanists[/color] may require to help with weeds and accelerate plant growth, - [color=#a4885c]Space Cleaner[/color], [color=#a4885c]Bleach[/color] or [color=#a4885c]Rat Poison[/color] for the janitor, - [color=#a4885c]Condiments[/color] for the [color=#a4885c]Chef[/color], - [color=#a4885c]Weaponized chemicals[/color] for the [color=#a4885c]Security[/color] department or the [color=#a4885c]Cargo's Salvage Specialists[/color] to fight off space carps, - [color=#a4885c]Iron[/color] or [color=#a4885c]Tricordrazine[/color] for the Bartender's drinks, - [color=#a4885c]Questionnably Legal Drugs[/color] (Space Drugs / Meth / LSD) for your bored colleagues, - Anything a crew member could ask. 

 It is your job as the [color=#a4885c]Chemist[/color] to [color=#a4885c]accept[/color] or [color=#a4885c]deny[/color] requests and [color=#a4885c]prioritize[/color] which drugs to produce.
## Tools Your work will mostly revolve around these [color=#a4885c]devices[/color] :

 The [color=#a4885c]Chem Dispenser[/color] is the device you will interact with [color=#a4885c]the most[/color] as a Chemist. 
 Its main purpose is to [color=#a4885c]acquire[/color] and [color=#a4885c]mix[/color] chemicals. 

 You have an [color=#a4885c]infinite supply[/color] of chemicals but require [color=#a4885c]power[/color] to use it. 

 In order to use it, you will need to : - [color=#a4885c]Click[/color] on it with a [color=#a4885c]beaker[/color] to put it in. - [color=#a4885c]Open[/color] the chemical dispenser's [color=#a4885c]GUI[/color], - Select the [color=#a4885c]amount (u)[/color] to add to the [color=#a4885c]beaker[/color], - Select the [color=#a4885c]chemical[/color] you want to add to the [color=#a4885c]beaker[/color], 
 (Note that the [color=#a4885c]chemicals[/color] will [color=#a4885c]react instantly[/color]) - Click [color=#a4885c]Eject[/color] to retrieve your [color=#a4885c]beaker[/color]. 

 When some specific [color=#a4885c]chemicals[/color] end up in the [color=#a4885c]same beaker[/color] as other specific [color=#a4885c]chemicals[/color] in the right [color=#a4885c]quantities[/color], may that be through the use of the chemical dispenser or manually transfering the two, they [color=#a4885c]mix[/color] and form a [color=#a4885c]new, different chemical[/color]. 

 For instance, mixing : - [color=#a4885c]1u[/color] of [color=#a4885c]oxygen[/color], - [color=#a4885c]1u[/color] of [color=#a4885c]sugar[/color], - [color=#a4885c]1u[/color] of [color=#a4885c]carbon[/color] 

 Will give you [color=#a4885c]3u[/color] of [color=#a4885c]Inaprovaline[/color]. 
 Obviously, you can very well take [color=#a4885c]30u[/color] of each to produce [color=#a4885c]90u[/color] of [color=#a4885c]Inaprovaline[/color] right away, the recipe will [color=#a4885c]still work[/color] as long as the [color=#a4885c]proportions are respected[/color].

 The [color=#a4885c]ChemMaster4000[/color] is what you use to produce [color=#a4885c]pills[/color] and [color=#a4885c]bottles[/color] of the [color=#a4885c]chemical[/color] of your choosing. 

 In order to use it, you will need to : - [color=#a4885c]Load[/color] a [color=#a4885c]container[/color] into it, like a [color=#a4885c]pill cannister[/color] or a [color=#a4885c]bottle[/color], - [color=#a4885c]Load[/color] a [color=#a4885c]beaker[/color] of the [color=#a4885c]chemicals[/color] you wish to turn into [color=#a4885c]pills[/color] or a [color=#a4885c]bottle[/color]. - Click the [color=#a4885c]Transfer[/color] button in the [color=#a4885c]center[/color] of the [color=#a4885c]UI[/color]. - In the [color=#a4885c]Input tab[/color], select the [color=#a4885c]quantity[/color] of each [color=#a4885c]chemical[/color] you wish to transfer into the [color=#a4885c]buffer[/color]. 
 (Note: the numbers are in (u), 'all' transfers the entirety of the chemical) - In the [color=#a4885c]Output tab[/color], make sure you see your [color=#a4885c]container[/color] ([color=#a4885c]pill cannister[/color] or [color=#a4885c]bottle[/color]) at the [color=#a4885c]top[/color], and name your [color=#a4885c]pill[/color] / [color=#a4885c]bottle[/color] with a [color=#a4885c]label[/color]. - Once that is done, change the [color=#a4885c]dose[/color] (in (u)) to put into your [color=#a4885c]pill[/color]/[color=#a4885c]bottle[/color]. 
 (Note: the dose in (u) is for [color=#a4885c]each individual pill[/color]). - Finally, press the [color=#a4885c]Eject[/color] button at the [color=#a4885c]top right[/color] of the [color=#a4885c]UI[/color] to [color=#a4885c]retrieve[/color] your [color=#a4885c]bottle[/color] / [color=#a4885c]pill cannister[/color].
The [color=#a4885c]Reagent Grinder[/color] enables objects to be [color=#a4885c]ground[/color] or [color=#a4885c]liquified[/color]. A [color=#a4885c]Large Beaker[/color] must be loaded into the [color=#a4885c]Reagent Grinder[/color] in order to use it. 

 A chemist will need to grind [color=#a4885c]1 object of plasma[/color] in order to make some medication like [color=#a4885c]Dexalin[/color]. 
 Only [color=#a4885c]one object[/color] can be ground at a time so if you insert a [color=#a4885c]stack of objects[/color] it will [color=#a4885c]not work[/color]. 

 The [color=#a4885c]Reagent Grinder[/color] can also be used to [color=#a4885c]test the contents[/color] of [color=#a4885c]pills[/color] : 
 Insert the [color=#a4885c]pill[/color] and a [color=#a4885c]beaker[/color] and then click [color=#a4885c]Grind[/color] in order to [color=#a4885c]return the contents[/color] of the [color=#a4885c]pill[/color] to the [color=#a4885c]beaker[/color] in [color=#a4885c]liquid form[/color].
## Getting Supplies A Chemistry lab typically starts off with several supplies including : - [color=#a4885c]Beaker Boxes[/color] (with [color=#a4885c]beakers[/color] and [color=#a4885c]large beakers[/color]), - [color=#a4885c]Pill Cannister Boxes[/color] (with [color=#a4885c]pill cannisters[/color]), - [color=#a4885c]Bottle Boxes[/color], (with [color=#a4885c]bottles[/color]), - [color=#a4885c]Syringe Boxes[/color] (with, you guessed it, [color=#a4885c]syringes[/color]).
On some maps, there will also be [color=#a4885c]plasma[/color] available. 
 To acquire [color=#a4885c]more supplies[/color], you can always try going to these different [color=#a4885c]departments[/color] : - [color=#a4885c]Cargo[/color], to request a [color=#a4885c]Chemistry Supplies Crate[/color] (it will contain several boxes of supplies therein), - [color=#a4885c]Salvage[/color], to request [color=#a4885c]Plasma[/color] from their journeys in space, - [color=#a4885c]Science[/color], to request [color=#a4885c]bottles[/color], [color=#a4885c]beakers[/color], [color=#a4885c]pill cannisters[/color] or [color=#a4885c]droppers[/color] to be produced, - [color=#a4885c]Science[/color], to request [color=#a4885c]machines[/color] to be [color=#a4885c]made[/color], [color=#a4885c]replaced[/color] or even [color=#a4885c]upgraded[/color], - [color=#a4885c]Science[/color], to request [color=#a4885c]grenade components[/color] so that a [color=#a4885c]heal grenade[/color] can be made, - [color=#a4885c]Botany[/color], to request [color=#a4885c]medical plants[/color] or [color=#a4885c]aloe cream[/color], - [color=#a4885c]Bartender[/color], to Request a [color=#a4885c]100u Shaker[/color] in case of [color=#a4885c]utter emergency[/color].

## Final Tips - Since the [color=#a4885c]4 most common damage types[/color] are [color=#a4885c]Brute[/color], [color=#a4885c]Burn[/color], [color=#a4885c]Airloss[/color] and [color=#a4885c]Toxin[/color], you will need to produce medicine for all of them as well as for [color=#a4885c]blood loss[/color]. - It is [color=#a4885c]strongly recommended[/color] to specify the (u) in pills in the [color=#a4885c]label[/color] in order to avoid [color=#a4885c]overdoses[/color]. - Some chemicals like [color=#a4885c]Dexalin Plus[/color] and [color=#a4885c]Epinephrine[/color] can be served as either a [color=#a4885c]pill[/color] or [color=#a4885c]liquid[/color] in a beaker / bottle. 
 As they are used to treat [color=#a4885c]critical conditions[/color] (often in people with a [color=#a4885c]suit[/color] or [color=#a4885c]breathe[/color] mask on), consider delivering the liquid in a [color=#a4885c]bottle[/color] and [color=#a4885c]injecting it into the patient[/color]. 

 As [color=#a4885c]Dexalin Plus[/color] is not only for critical situations though, having it both in [color=#a4885c]bottles[/color] and as [color=#a4885c]pills[/color] can be handy. 
 In contrast [color=#a4885c]non-critical on-demand chemicals[/color] like [color=#a4885c]Spaceacillin[/color] can be offered as pills as crew have a tendency to either smash or steal the beakers. 

 Also, Medical staff may get [color=#a4885c]demand for bruise packs[/color] by crewmembers that go into space as they can apply it in space [color=#a4885c]without taking off their helmet[/color]. 
 As a chemist, [color=#a4885c]don't get insulted by this[/color]! -For a more in-depth look at the Chemist's job and a [color=#a4885c]complete list[/color] of chemicals and their [color=#a4885c]recipes[/color], visit the [color=#a4885c]official Space Station 14 Wiki[/color].
